member.summary: Dispatcher's tag. This member is not used by Genuine Channels, so you can use it on your own.

member.name: P:Belikov.GenuineChannels.BroadcastEngine.Dispatcher.ReceiveResultsTimeOut
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum time span to receive responses from the receivers. If reply has not been received during this period of time, OperationException with GenuineChannels.Exception.Broadcast.RemoteEndPointDidNotReplyForTimeOut error identifier will be fired.

member.name: P:Belikov.GenuineChannels.BroadcastEngine.Dispatcher.CallIsAsync
member.summary: If this member is false, then broadcast call is synchronous. That is the caller's thread waits until all receivers replies or timeout elapses. If this member is true and BroadcastCallFinishedHandler member is not null, then broadcast call is asynchronous. Accordingly, control is returned to the caller as soon as broadcast invocation will be initiated. When all receivers reply or timeout is elapsed, the BroadcastCallFinishedHandler callback is called.

member.name: P:Belikov.GenuineChannels.BroadcastEngine.Dispatcher.BroadcastCallFinishedHandler
member.summary: Delegate to be called when an async call is finished.

member.name: E:Belikov.GenuineChannels.BroadcastEngine.Dispatcher.BroadcastReceiverHasBeenExcluded
member.summary: Signals that a receiver has been excluded from the receiver list. The sponsor for the receiver is detached after this event.

member.name: P:Belikov.GenuineChannels.BroadcastEngine.Dispatcher.MaximumNumberOfConsecutiveFailsToExcludeReceiverAutomatically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum allowed number of consecutive failures that can be made by a receiver. As soon as the receiver consecutively fails for this number of time, it is automatically removed from the receiver list. You can set this value to zero in order to prevent automatic excluding. I would recommend to set a large value (for example, 100) in this case. Remember, each time the receiver sends successful response, counter for this receiver is resetted to zero.

member.name: P:Belikov.GenuineChannels.BroadcastEngine.Dispatcher.MaximumNumberOfConsecutiveFailsToEnableSimulationMode
member.summary: Represents a value indicating the maximum number of failures allowing to specific remote receiver before switching it to simulation mode. That is as soon as a true broadcast sender will not be able to deliver a message consecutively for this number of tries to the specific receiver, it will automatically start sending messages to this specific receiver via the usual channel. Set it to zero to prevent switching to simulation mode. I would recommend to set a large value (for example, 100) in this case. Remember, each time the receiver sends successful response to the message sent via true multicast channel, this counter is resetted to zero and receiver is switched back to normal mode when messages are delivered via "true" multicast channel.

member.name: P:Belikov.GenuineChannels.BroadcastEngine.Dispatcher.IgnoreRecurrentCalls
member.summary: Gets or sets an value indicating whether the recurrent calls received via different transports will be ignored. Also, if you register the same receiver twice and turn on this option, it will be invoked only once.

member.summary: The connection is in indeterminate state.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.DotNetRemotingLayer.GenuineEventType.GeneralConnectionEstablished
member.summary: The connection was established.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.DotNetRemotingLayer.GenuineEventType.GeneralServerRestartDetected
member.summary: The remote server has been restarted. All URIs and transparent proxies became invalid. Client application has to re-login and reattach to all server's events.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.DotNetRemotingLayer.GenuineEventType.GeneralConnectionReestablishing
member.summary: The connection has been broken but will be probably restored.

member.summary: The connection was closed and all resources related to this connection were released.

member.summary: Connection Manager successfully started listening to the specific local end point.

member.summary: Connection Manager stopped listening to the specific local end point.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.DotNetRemotingLayer.GenuineEventType.GeneralListenerFailure
member.summary: Connection Manager caught an exception during accepting connection.

member.summary: GTCP connection accepted from the client. You can analyze client's end point and reject the connection.

member.summary: GHTTP connection accepted from the client.

member.summary: An exception fired by UDP socket.

member.summary: Broadcast message directed to unassigned court was received.

member.summary: A request has come to the unknown server service.

member.summary: Unknown security session is requested by the remote peer.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.DotNetRemotingLayer.GenuineEventType.SecuritySessionFailed
member.summary: Security session failed. All requests sent in this security context will result in exception. All responses will be lost (actually the current design of Genuine Channels prevents from having such responses, but in general it's possible).

member.summary: All resources associated with the remote host were released.

member.summary: Requests message processing from the current sink.

member.returns: A ServerProcessing status value that provides information about how message was processed.

member.name: M:Belikov.GenuineChannels.GenuineSharedMemory.NamedEvent.CreateNamedEvent(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates named event object.
member.param: The name of the event object.
If this parameter is TRUE, the initial state of the event object is signaled; otherwise, it is nonsignaled.
If this parameter is FALSE, the function creates an auto-reset event object, and system automatically resets the state to nonsignaled after a single waiting thread has been released.
member.returns: Created event object.

member.name: M:Belikov.GenuineChannels.GenuineSharedMemory.NamedEvent.WaitOne(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the current WaitHandle receives a signal, using 32-bit signed integer to measure the time interval and specifying whether to exit the synchronization domain before the wait.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait for the thread to receive a signal.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
member.returns: True if the current instance receives a signal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Belikov.GenuineChannels.GenuineSharedMemory.NamedEvent.WaitOne(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the current instance receives a signal, using a TimeSpan to measure the time interval and specifying whether to exit the synchronization domain before the wait.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait for the thread to receive a signal.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
member.returns: True if the current instance receives a signal; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Parameters.GenuineParameter.NoSizeChecking
member.summary: [BOOL] Cancels message size checking. As a result, Genuine Channels message engine does not check the size of the stream and this increases performance for messages containing streams without Stream.Length property support (no exceptions are thrown and caught).

member.summary: [TimeSpan] The time span value to close opened or accepted named connections after this period of inactivity. TimeSpan.Zero value means immediate connection closing after receiving a response.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Parameters.GenuineParameter.CloseInvocationConnectionAfterInactivity
member.summary: [TimeSpan] The time span value to close opened or accepted invocation connections after this period of inactivity. TimeSpan.Zero value means immediate connection closing after receiving a response.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Parameters.GenuineParameter.CloseOneWayConnectionAfterInactivity
member.summary: [TimeSpan] The time span value to close opened or accepted one-way connection after, doesn't matter whether something is being sent or received through it.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Parameters.GenuineParameter.PersistentConnectionSendPingAfterInactivity
member.summary: [TimeSpan] An empty message (6 byte) is sent to the remote host if there were no messages sent to the remote host within this time span.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Parameters.GenuineParameter.MaxTimeSpanToReconnect
member.summary: [TimeSpan] The time span before considering the persistent connection to be broken if it wasn't reestablished.

member.summary: [INT] The maximum number of reconnection tries before declaring a connection to be closed.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Parameters.GenuineParameter.SleepBetweenReconnections
member.summary: [TimeSpan] Time span to sleep for after each reconnection failure.

member.name: T:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Security.ZeroProofAuthorization.ZpaFeatureFlags
member.summary: Enumerates features provided by Zero Proof Authorization Security Provider. WARNING: serialized as a byte.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Security.ZeroProofAuthorization.ZpaFeatureFlags.None
member.summary: Simple authentication without content encryption.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Security.ZeroProofAuthorization.ZpaFeatureFlags.ElectronicCodebookEncryption
member.summary: Enables Rijndael 256-bit encryption in the electronic codebook (ECB, no chaining between blocks) mode.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Security.ZeroProofAuthorization.ZpaFeatureFlags.CipherBlockChainingEncryption
member.summary: Enables Rijndael 256-bit encryption with the chaining mode of operation of the cipher. This is the strongest generally available mode of operation. Unless you explicitly have a reason to choose another chaining mode, you probably want to use this type of cipher block chaining.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Security.ZeroProofAuthorization.ZpaFeatureFlags.Mac3DesCbcSigning
member.summary: Enables the packet integrity checking based on MAC-3DES-CBC (64-bit) keyed hash algorithm.

member.name: F:Belikov.GenuineChannels.Security.ZeroProofAuthorization.ZpaFeatureFlags.HmacSha1Signing
member.summary: Enables the packet integrity checking based on HMAC-SHA1 (160-bit) keyed hash algorithm.

member.summary: The second stage of the initialization.
